item.title: New Poster: Capitalism Is Doomed
item.content_encoded:
As seen in Wisconsin, inside and outside the occupation of the capitol building in Madison in protest against new government austerity measures, we've designed a new poster heralding the downfall of capitalism. Download PDF : 864kb To be clear, we're not certain that capitalism is about to collapse. However, we're convinced that it is doomed--such a volatile and destructive system cannot possibly last forever--and that it is entering a new phase of crisis. All the old peace treaties are coming to an end: unions have been outflanked by globalization, while the Fordist compromise of higher wages for obedient workforces has given way in the course of the transition to a service-based economy. These peace treaties were not simply ways to pacify resistance movements--they also served to perpetuate capitalism itself. Without the higher wages won by the old labor movement, for example, consumers can't afford to keep rates of profit up for capitalists. Consequently, at the moment of its worldwide triumph, capitalism has run out of ways to expand, heralding a new period of instability. The next several years will surely be marked by more upheavals like the ones in Greece and Egypt; these may even reach the United States. In that context, a poster like this is really an attempt to cast a spell, to convey a vote of no confidence in capitalism in hopes that it will be infectious. If capitalism is indeed entering a period of crisis, anarchists must not miss this opportunity to spread a vision of an alternative. It is precisely before the upheavals that we can do this most effectively: people's idea of what is possible can change very quickly in the midst of turmoil, but their idea of what is desirable often changes much more slowly. If we miss this opportunity, we may see yet another phase of revolutionary struggles fought merely for "better democracy"--wasting an opportunity that will not come again for a generation. Therefore, we invite you to join us in covering the walls of North America with posters like this, and to brainstorm ways to escalate the conflict that point towards real liberation. We've been working feverishly on further projects to this end, which we will unveil shortly.
According to state officials, humble little posters such as this one inflicted $7.5 million dollars in damage upon the capitol building in Madison. Would that protesters really did inflict so much damage on every capitol!
For news from Wisconsin, try the burnt bookmobile website.

wp_comment.wp_comment_content: I was wondering where those came from.

It's really frustrating that you make some of these posters specific to the United States when they could easily be changed to apply to capitalist states in general. You don't always need to mention the U.S. by name, it makes it difficult to find applications for the poster in other countries.

Sorry if that's frustrating. We can try to take your concern into consideration in the future. At the same time, we usually try to "play our position" by focusing on the things we know best, in the heart of the beast. We've also produced materials for use primarily in other countries--for example, the G20 solidarity posters
It's also possible for people to take elements of our posters and rework them to be relevant to their local situations. You can do that with a xerox machine and a marker even if you don't know design programs. Good luck there.
In any case, capital is global but "the enemy is here!". Wherever that is.

Seriously, I just want to start my own topic on in this blog, I think I can provide valuable insight into one of you're worst enemies. Fearing repercussions I will refer to them only as the "Beast" or "Faceless Monster" until I am in a more secure position in my life.
With that being said, would someone please direct me to the link where I can post my own topics in this blog, it's sure to spurn quite a neutral reaction from most. (neutral is much better than the blatant evil that I see portrayed by my co-workers daily...
